title: Katie McGlynn admits she’s happy to be leaving Coronation Street after six years

Sinead Tinker actress Katie McGlynn has admitted she is happy to be leaving Coronation Street after seven years.

The soap star, 26, opened up about the end of her Corrie era ahead of her character Sinead's final scenes in the soap, which will air later this year.

Sinead will soon lose her battle with cervical cancer after it spreads throughout her body, with doctors recently giving her just months to live.

(Image: OK!/Craig Fleming)

Katie confessed to OK! Magazine : "Selfishly, I was really pleased."

The 26-year-old actress admitted that she was tempted to leave the soap two years ago after she felt that Corrie Bosses hadn’t given her a "decent story."

However, Katie changed her mind when she found out about Sinead's diagnosis: "Then I was told about the cervical cancer storyline."

Katie's on-screen character's emotional two-year battle with cervical cancer is coming to an end and the soap star revealed she wanted Sinead to die from the cancer.

She confessed: "I said we should finish with the saddest ending because life’s not a fairy tale.

"I’ve been affected by people in my family who had cancer and I wanted to showcase that. I think a soap should reflect real life, I’m saddened that I’m leaving, but I want to create awareness."

(Image: ITV)

The star recently revealed to This Morning that she'd sobbed on set throughout her last episode.

"It's heartbreaking, but it's real life. When we were doing scenes that day, I thought that I can't imagine this happening to me," she said.

It comes after Katie had a big leaving party to celebrate filming her final scenes on Corrie.

(Image: Instagram)

The actress was joined by Antony Cotton , who plays Sean Tully; Sally-Ann Matthews (Jenny Connor)and Georgia Taylor (Toyah Battersby), as well as Jane Danson (Leanne Battersby) and Daniel Brocklebank (Billy Mayhew).

Katie has previously spoken out about the impact of Sinead's tragic storyline .

She proudly revealed nurses have contacted her to tell her that the number of women going for smear tests has soared since the tragic plot unfolded.

Katie said: "It’s messages like this that make it all worthwhile. Feel privileged to be a part of this storyline."
description: The soap star is set to leave the cobbles for good after seven years in the role but looks forward to her exit
